title: Behavioral, Functional, and Neurophysiological Responses to One-week Administration of Escitalopram
author: Eóin Molloy; Universität Leipzig
text:
- AutorIn
- Eóin Molloy
- Titel
- Behavioral, Functional, and Neurophysiological Responses to One-week Administration of Escitalopram

- Abstract (EN)
- Doctoral thesis assessing the effects of one-week of escitalopram administration on healthy humans during sequence motor learning training. Published in 3 research articles.
- Forschungsdatenverweis
- Modulation of premotor cortex response to sequence motor learning during escitalopram-intake
DOI:
[10.1177/0271678X20965161](http://dx.doi.org/10.1177/0271678X20965161)
- Decreased thalamo-cortico connectivity during an implicit sequence motor learning task and 7 days escitalopram intake
DOI:
[10.1038/s41598-021-94009-7](http://dx.doi.org/10.1038/s41598-021-94009-7)
- One-week escitalopram intake alters the excitation-inhibition balance in the healthy female brain
DOI:
[10.1002/hbm.25760](http://dx.doi.org/10.1002/hbm.25760)
